trans-unit.source: Connect to SQL Database by using Python on Windows
trans-unit.target: Connect to SQL Database by using Python on Windows

trans-unit.source: Presents a Python code sample you can use to connect to Azure SQL Database from a Windows client.
trans-unit.target: Presents a Python code sample you can use to connect to Azure SQL Database from a Windows client.

trans-unit.source: The sample uses the pymssql driver.
trans-unit.target: The sample uses the pymssql driver.

trans-unit.source: Connect to SQL Database by using Python on Windows
trans-unit.target: Connect to SQL Database by using Python on Windows

trans-unit.source: This topic presents a code sample written in Python.
trans-unit.target: This topic presents a code sample written in Python.

trans-unit.source: The sample runs on a Windows computer.
trans-unit.target: The sample runs on a Windows computer.

trans-unit.source: The sample and connects to Azure SQL Database by using the **pymssql** driver.
trans-unit.target: The sample and connects to Azure SQL Database by using the **pymssql** driver.

trans-unit.source: Requirements
trans-unit.target: Requirements

trans-unit.source: Python 2.7.6
trans-unit.target: Python 2.7.6

trans-unit.source: Install the required modules
trans-unit.target: Install the required modules

trans-unit.source: Install [pymssql](http://www.lfd.uci.edu/~gohlke/pythonlibs/#pymssql).
trans-unit.target: Install [pymssql](http://www.lfd.uci.edu/~gohlke/pythonlibs/#pymssql).

trans-unit.source: Make sure you choose the correct whl file.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you choose the correct whl file.

trans-unit.source: For example : If you are using Python 2.7 on a 64 bit machine choose : pymssql‑2.1.1‑cp27‑none‑win_amd64.whl.
trans-unit.target: For example : If you are using Python 2.7 on a 64 bit machine choose : pymssql‑2.1.1‑cp27‑none‑win_amd64.whl.

trans-unit.source: Once you download the .whl file place it in the the C:/Python27 folder.
trans-unit.target: Once you download the .whl file place it in the the C:/Python27 folder.

trans-unit.source: Now install the pymssql driver using pip from command line.
trans-unit.target: Now install the pymssql driver using pip from command line.

trans-unit.source: cd into C:/Python27 and run the following
trans-unit.target: cd into C:/Python27 and run the following

trans-unit.source: Instructions to enable the use pip can be found [here](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4750806/how-to-install-pip-on-windows)
trans-unit.target: Instructions to enable the use pip can be found [here](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4750806/how-to-install-pip-on-windows)

trans-unit.source: Create a database and retrieve your connection string
trans-unit.target: Create a database and retrieve your connection string

trans-unit.source: See the [Getting Started Topic](sql-database-get-started.md) to learn how to create a sample database and retrieve your connection string.
trans-unit.target: See the [Getting Started Topic](sql-database-get-started.md) to learn how to create a sample database and retrieve your connection string.

trans-unit.source: It is important you follow the guide to create an **AdventureWorks database template**.
trans-unit.target: It is important you follow the guide to create an **AdventureWorks database template**.

trans-unit.source: The samples shown below only work with the **AdventureWorks schema**.
trans-unit.target: The samples shown below only work with the **AdventureWorks schema**.

trans-unit.source: Connect to your SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Connect to your SQL Database

trans-unit.source: The [pymssql.connect](http://pymssql.org/en/latest/ref/pymssql.html) function is used to connect to SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The [pymssql.connect](http://pymssql.org/en/latest/ref/pymssql.html) function is used to connect to SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Execute an SQL SELECT statement
trans-unit.target: Execute an SQL SELECT statement

trans-unit.source: The [cursor.execute](http://pymssql.org/en/latest/ref/pymssql.html#pymssql.Cursor.execute) function can be used to retrieve a result set from a query against SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The [cursor.execute](http://pymssql.org/en/latest/ref/pymssql.html#pymssql.Cursor.execute) function can be used to retrieve a result set from a query against SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: This function essentially accepts any query and returns a result set which can be iterated over with the use of [cursor.fetchone()](http://pymssql.org/en/latest/ref/pymssql.html#pymssql.Cursor.fetchone).
trans-unit.target: This function essentially accepts any query and returns a result set which can be iterated over with the use of [cursor.fetchone()](http://pymssql.org/en/latest/ref/pymssql.html#pymssql.Cursor.fetchone).

trans-unit.source: Insert a row, pass parameters, and retrieve the generated primary key
trans-unit.target: Insert a row, pass parameters, and retrieve the generated primary key

trans-unit.source: In SQL Database the [IDENTITY](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms186775.aspx) property and the [SEQUENCE](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff878058.aspx) object can be used to auto-generate [primary key](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms179610.aspx) values.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Database the [IDENTITY](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms186775.aspx) property and the [SEQUENCE](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff878058.aspx) object can be used to auto-generate [primary key](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms179610.aspx) values.

trans-unit.source: Transactions
trans-unit.target: Transactions

trans-unit.source: This code example demonstrates the use of transactions in which you:
trans-unit.target: This code example demonstrates the use of transactions in which you:

trans-unit.source: -Begin a transaction
trans-unit.target: -Begin a transaction

trans-unit.source: -Insert a row of data
trans-unit.target: -Insert a row of data

trans-unit.source: -Rollback your transaction to undo the insert
trans-unit.target: -Rollback your transaction to undo the insert
